availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Wayne County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Elizabeth Ingram. Father of Zerilda Ingram. Farmer in Wayne County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Wayne County in 1850. Farmer in Wayne County in 1860. Owned five enslaved person in Wayne County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, Division 1, p. 291A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, p. 291.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, District 1, p. 26B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, Division 1, p. 581.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, p. 475B.
Find A Grave, "Samuel Ingram (1792-1881)," Memorial #69423743, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/69423743 (accessed June 30, 2020).
